instructions.display_text: Make the hummus Caesar dressing: In a medium bowl, combine 4 tablespoons of hummus, the mustard, garlic, nutritional yeast, capers, lemon juice, miso, and olive oil. Whisk until fully combined. Add another tablespoon of hummus if the dressing is looser than your desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste. The dressing will keep in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Make the salad: Add the greens to a large serving bowl and lightly season with lemon juice and salt. Generously drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Finish with more black pepper, as desired.
Enjoy!

results.keywords: caesar, caesar dressing, easy salad, hummus, salad, vegan, vegan dressing
results.name: Hummus Caesar Salad
results.description: Vegan caesar has never been easier thanks to this time saving hack! Using hummus as the base of the dressing gives you richness while being both nut and dairy free. Adjust the consistency to your liking by adding more hummus for a thicker dressing or more water for thinner. This dressing is packed with flavor thanks to brininess from the capers, cheesiness from the nutritional yeast, and umami from the miso.

components.raw_text: 1 teaspoon white miso, dissolved in 1½ tablespoons hot water
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste

results.name: Spring Vegetable Chowder

instructions.display_text: In a large pot, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the riced cauliflower, leeks, garlic, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Sauté for 2 minutes, until the leeks just begin to soften.

Pour in the vegetable stock and 2 cups (480 ml) of non-dairy milk. Increase the heat to medium-high and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, until the cauliflower is completely broken down and tender.

Meanwhile, in a large pan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the asparagus, peas, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Sauté for 2 minutes, until the vegetables are bright green with some crunch. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the lemon zest and basil. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Wipe out the pan and add the potatoes and enough cold water to cover by 1 inch (1 ¼ cm). Season with 1 tablespoon of salt. Bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 8-10 minutes, until the potatoes are easily pierced with a fork but not mushy. Drain and set aside.

Remove the pot with the cauliflower from the heat. Blend with an immersion blender until completely smooth and creamy. Add up to 1 cup (240 ml) non-dairy milk or water if needed to thin to your desired consistency.
Stir in the reserved asparagus, peas, potatoes, and the lemon juice. Season to taste with salt.
Ladle into bowls and garnish with fresh basil, a drizzle of olive oil, and freshly ground black pepper.
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: ¼ cup olive oil, divided, plus more for drizzling
2 leeks (5 ounces), tough green ends removed, cut into half moons and rinsed (about 2 cups)
components.extra_comment: tough green ends removed, cut into half moons and rinsed

components.raw_text: 1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided, plus more to taste
components.extra_comment: plus 2 teaspoons, divided, plus more to taste

components.raw_text: 2 cups non-dairy milk, plus more to taste, divided
1 bunch (10 ounces) asparagus, woody stems removed, cut into ½-inch pieces (about 2 heaping cups)
components.extra_comment: woody stems removed, cut into 1/2 in (1 1/4 cm) pieces

components.raw_text: ¼ cup thinly sliced fresh basil, plus more for garnish
1½ pounds medium red potatoes, cut into ½-inch cubes
Freshly ground black pepper, for garnish

compilations.description: Peas might've been your childhood nemesis but as you've gotten older, you've come to appreciate the beauty in a freshly-harvested, bright green pea. Whether it's in our split pea soup or our hearty spring vegetable chowder, peas are the star. They even shine through in our teriyaki chicken fried rice. So get out there and grab yourself a hap-pea meal!

compilations.name: Easy BBQ Recipes for a Great BBQ
compilations.description: Nothing says summer like a great BBQ! If you want to host your first cookout but aren’t quite sure where to start, bookmark these easy BBQ recipes. You’ll learn how to make your own BBQ sauce, along with coleslaw and chicken sandwiches to feed a crowd (or, you know, just yourself for a few days). And if that’s not enough, you can also make this super delicious strawberry shortcake that is sure to turn you into a true BBQ hero.

instructions.display_text: Place the potatoes in a large pot, cover with enough cold water to cover the potatoes by 2 inches (5 cm), and bring to a boil. Season with ½ teaspoon salt, reduce the heat to medium, cover, and cook until the potatoes are fork-tender, 10-15 minutes. Drain and set aside to cool slightly.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the bacon for five minutes or until crispy. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
Add the onion to the bacon fat in the pan. Cook until tender and golden, about 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat.
In a large bowl, whisk together the vinegar and mustard. Season with the remaining teaspoon of salt and the pepper. Add the potatoes, bacon, and onions. Toss to coat. Stir in the chives. Serve warm.
Enjoy!

1 8-ounce can sliced water chestnuts, drained and finely chopped

compilations.name: Goodful's Top Ten Vegan Recipes of 2020
Vegan Appetizers Based On Your Zodiac Signs
Refreshing Springtime Meals
compilations.description: Is spring your favorite season? Well, you're in luck! These recipes will make sure your love for the season powers on. Take your pick, from Shrimp Avocado Taco Salad to Tofu Lettuce Wraps With Mushrooms. We're sure these will refresh your tastebuds and your spirit!

compilations.name: 'Wrap up' Your Day With These Lettuce Wraps
compilations.description: If you're trying to get in more lettuce, think beyond salads. This teriyaki chicken lettuce wrap is easy to make and delicious to eat. For a real flavor explosion, might we recommend our shrimp and herb lettuce wraps? And our protein and veggie-loaded tofu wraps are great after a long day at work. Lettuce blow your minds with these meals.

compilations.name: Quick Work Lunches
compilations.description: Work can get hectic, and in those moments you need quick and tasty fuel more than ever. Whip up a nutritious chicken ranch wrap with some store-bought rotisserie chicken. Or if you're going meatless, our tofu lettuce wraps with mushrooms are an ideal mid-day meal. We personally love this loaded chicken burrito bowl that you can make on a sheet pan! Say hello to your new favorite work lunches.

compilations.name: Mushrooms 18 Ways
compilations.description: When you have mushroom on hand, you're always just minutes away from a great meal. For a delicious weeknight recipe, whip up some garlic parmesan stuffed mushroom paired with a one-pot chicken mushroom pasta. Or, simply whip up some comforting cream of mushroom soup! Or get a taste of Japan with this Japanese arancini. The options are endless!

Lettuce introduce you to the new star of the show: leafy goodness that wraps up all of your favorite ingredients for a flavor-packed bite. From Buffalo Chicken Lettuce Wraps to Tofu Lettuce Wraps with Mushrooms, you'll want to dig right in!
compilations.name: Lettuce Wrap This Up

instructions.display_text: Remove the tofu from its packaging and drain. Wrap tofu in a kitchen towel and find a heavy object to place on top of tofu, leave it there for 10-20 minutes, until tofu feels more tender.
Make the sauce: In a medium bowl, combine the water, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, sriracha, brown sugar, rice wine vinegar, and scallions, and stir. Set ½ cup (120 ml) of the sauce aside.
Crumble the tofu into the marinade, cover, and refrigerate for 1 hour.

In a medium wok or skillet over medium heat, add the sesame oil and onion, and cook 3 minutes, until onions are translucent. Add the mushrooms and garlic and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender.

Add the marinated tofu to the pan and cook until the majority of marinade cooks off. Add the water chestnuts and scallions. Pour in the reserved sauce. Toss to coat and cook until just heated through. Transfer the tofu mixture to a medium bowl.

Heat the canola oil in the same pan over high heat until a drop of water sizzles when flicked onto the oil. Fry the rice noodles for about 30 seconds, until puffed up. Transfer the fried noodles to paper towels to drain.
Slice the core off the head of lettuce and separate into individual leaves.
Serve with leaves of lettuce, rice noodles, and drizzle remaining sauce over top.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: Fresh Fruit Salads For A Whole Week!
compilations.description: Fruit bowls are all the rage: acai, smoothie, you name it! They're refreshing, juicy and absolutely delicious. You might find yourself wondering, "What if I could have a fruit bowl, everyday?" Lucky for you, we're here to make that dream a reality. When the mid-week blues get the better of you, test out our Watermelon Salad with Arugula & Feta. Then, kick the blues away with our Honey Lime Rainbow Fruit Salad. It's time to eat the rainbow and, well, it's never been better.

compilations.name: 30 Days 30 Salads
compilations.description: Eating healthy does not have to be boring & mundane! These 30 salads will have you covered for a whole month. You read that right! If you'd like to keep it simple, we have our quintessential salads like the Caeser Salad, grilled veggie and steak salad and the Honey Lime Fruit Salad. But to take it up a notch, you can also go international with this Asian chicken chopped salad or this really yummy & elaborate Ethiopian salad. We personally love the Vietnamese Steak And Rice Noodle Salad the most!

results.name: Honey Lime Fruit Salad

results.keywords: angeled eggs, buzzfeed, deviled eggs, egg, eggs, food, food hacks, hacks, healthy, hot sauce, life hacks, mayo, muffin tin, pepper, recipe, relish, salt, tasty, tasty_vegetarian, whites, yogurt, yolk, yolks, yum

instructions.display_text: Crack twelve eggs, and separate the yolks and egg whites into separate bowls.
Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
Spray a mini muffin tin with nonstick spray. Pour each yolk and egg white into its own mini muffin tin hole.

Place the tin into a baking dish with a tinfoil ring, wire wrack, or a towel to keep the muffin tin from touching the bottom of the baking dish directly (so the eggs steam gently in the oven and don’t turn brown).
Cover the eggs and the baking dish tightly with aluminum foil. Make sure the foil tents up so it doesn’t touch any of the eggs.
Lift one edge of the foil and pour in boiling water ⅓ way up the muffin tin and re-cover with foil.
Place the eggs in the oven for 13 minutes. Check to make sure the egg whites and yolks are both fully cooked.
Remove foil and muffin tin from baking dish and let cool.
With a thin knife, remove the egg yolks and egg whites from the tin. Set the egg whites aside.
In a bowl, combine the cooked egg yolks, Greek yogurt, relish, mustard, hot sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix with a fork until well combined.
Place the mixture in a piping bag with a desirable tip and pipe the yolk mixture onto the cooked egg whites. Sprinkle with paprika and chopped parsley.
Enjoy!

instructions.display_text: In a medium bowl, combine all the ingredients for the chicken marinade.
Toss in the chicken thighs and marinate for at least one hour.
In a cast-iron skillet, cook chicken on high heat until there is a nice sear on the surface of the chicken, and the inside is no longer pink. Roughly four minutes each side. Set chicken aside.
Place chopped lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, and avocados in a large salad bowl.
Slice cooked chicken thighs and add to the salad bowl.
In a small bowl, combine all the ingredients for the dressing. Mix well.
Toss the salad with the dressing and serve immediately.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: Lime is one of those condiments that adds zest, freshness, or even a punch of flavor that sends a tingle all over your tongue. The chili-lime steak tacos are easy to cook up and delicious to eat. Our more classic pairing, lime with tilapia and avocado crema, is sure not to disappoint. And no menu celebrating lime would be complete without a key lime pie with toasted marshmallow meringue! You can put the lime in the coconut but truly, lime is always the star: don't you agree?
compilations.name: Lime Recipes That Will Change Your Life

compilations.description: When life gives you limes, just make a super tasty meal out of them! Try the Key Lime Waffles or a refreshing jar of Watermelon-Lime Slushie. In the mood for somethings sweet? Whip up this tempting Mango Lime Cheesecake.
compilations.name: Refreshing Lime Recipes

compilations.description: We know you love fries! But your potatoes are destined for so, so much more. Start your day with an impressive Breakfast Potato Volcano and walk your way up to a Loaded Scalloped Potato Dome for a fancy lunch. Take your pick and let’s get started!

components.raw_text: 3 cups of water ( enough to cover the potatoes)

instructions.display_text: Thinly slice potatoes.
Soak potatoes in just enough cold water to cover the potatoes for 10 minutes. Then pat dry.
Preheat oven to 400ºF (200ºC).
In a medium bowl, mix together heavy cream, salt, Italian seasoning, black pepper and melted butter.
Add potato slices and evenly coat every piece in the cream mixture.
Line baking tray with parchment paper and place one sheet of puff pastry. With a fork, evenly poke the entire sheet.
Place shredded or grated parmesan cheese on the puff pastry. Then layer each potato slice to cover the sheet, leaving ½ inch (1 ¼ cm) on all sides.
With 2 spoons, scoop small amounts of goat cheese on top of the potatoes. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Bake for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
With a peeler hold the bottom of the asparagus and carefully peel from bottom to the tip. Peel twice on one side, then flip over to peel the other side. It will give you a even ribbon.
Put all the asparagus ribbons into a bowl and mix in salt, pepper, olive oil and lemon juice. Toss the ribbons until evenly coated.
Place the asparagus ribbons on top of the freshly baked potato tart, then slice.
Enjoy!
